author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Barely a week after two engineers were killed over extortion demand in Darbhanga district, a Lok Janshakti Party MLA on Tuesday night received an extortion threat for Rs.10 lakh failing which, the blackmailer said, he and his family would be eliminated. Last month, an Independent MLA received a similar threat allegedly from Maoists.

First time LJP MLA Raju Tiwari from Govindganj assembly constituency in his complaint with the Malahi police in Govindganj in East Champaran said he received the threat through an SMS on his mobile phone.

“The SMS text says if I do not pay Rs.10 lakh, I and my family will be eliminated”, he said.

Police said they have started an investigation after receiving the complaint.
title: Bihar MLA gets extortion threat
